title: Timbuktu Ancient Library
description: This centuries-old library houses thousands of rare manuscripts that trace back to the golden age of West African scholarship.

title: Sahara Gate Park
description: A green oasis with trails, gardens, and a panoramic view of the desert edge.

title: Market of 333 Saints
description: This colorful open-air market honors the spiritual history of the region and offers traditional crafts, spices, and music.

title: Sunset Dunes Lookout
description: Climb the observation deck to watch the dunes glow gold and orange during the spectacular Sahara sunsets.

title: Djinguereber Mosque
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, this historic mosque is one of the oldest in West Africa and a symbol of Sahelian architecture.

title: Timbuktu Cultural Center
description: This museum and cultural hub features exhibits on Malian history, art, and the oral traditions that shaped the region.

title: River Niger Boardwalk
description: A peaceful boardwalk along the Niger River, great for walking, birdwatching, and catching cool breezes at dusk.

title: Festival in the Desert Grounds
description: The iconic site of the music and cultural festival that once brought Tuareg musicians and global artists together under desert skies.
